intro: Gentiana cephalodes, commonly known as the mountain gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps and surrounding regions. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are tubular with a distinctive blue or purple corolla, often with yellow or white markings. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
